publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-1650# Jamie Hepburn: Cumbernauld Bus Station—That the Parliament believes safe and accessible public transport has a key role to play in achieving sustainable economic growth in Scotland; recognises the importance of a modern and appropriate infrastructure to complement the public transport network; notes the dilapidated or non-existent state of bus station facilities in many areas of central Scotland, including the lack of a proper bus station in Cumbernauld town centre, and acknowledges the important role of transport authorities and operators in working together to provide and expedite safe, modern bus station facilities in Cumbernauld and elsewhere. Supported by: Hugh O’Donnell*, Rob Gibson*, Alasdair Allan*, Bill Kidd*, Christopher Harvie*, Kenneth Gibson*, Christina McKelvie*, Alex Neil*, Aileen Campbell*, Stuart McMillan*, Sandra White*, Robin Harper*
